main event: Two pilots in separate aircraft reported seeing a fast-moving blue light over the Palm Springs, California area in September 1954.
interesting points: The first pilot, in a Lockheed Lodstar aircraft, reported seeing the blue light over Riverside, California, moving southward at a high speed around 13,000 feet altitude.
The second pilot, in an unidentified aircraft (N852), reported seeing the same blue light moving southward at a high speed over Palm Springs, California.
A controller at the Los Angeles Air Route Traffic Control Center called the Riverside Flight Service to report the pilots' sightings.

The report mentions that the Riverside Flight Service was informed that a pilot in another aircraft (NRC32) also saw the blue light moving southward, but placed the location to the east, around Blythe, California.
The report includes details on the weather conditions at the time, noting clear skies with 15 miles visibility and no clouds or obstructions.
